section.title: Review of Wh- questions
section.sectiontitle: Common Wh- question words are what, who, when, where, how, which, whose and why. The question word usually comes at the beginning of the sentence, before the verb be or an auxiliary verb.
section.text1: My address is 10, The Lanes, Brighton.
section.text2: We went to an interesting restaurant last night.
section.text2a: Where did you go last night?
section.sectiontitle2: We form a lot of questions with how + adjective/adverb: how much, how many, how long, how tall, how old.
section.text3a: How much did your car cost?
section.text4: There are only 16 students in the group.
section.text4a: How many students are there in the group?
